about_the_game:
◆ Story


On a rainy night a few years ago, Molly, the owner of a bar, took in Hong'er, who had lost his memory.
Although he had no memories of the past, he thought that it didn't matter because he had Molly's company.
Life was happy now; even without the past, he could live a quiet life as Molly's adopted son.
--That was what Hong'er really thought until the man named Bowen came into his life.
His entanglement with Bowen, his growing acceptance of him, and the accidental revelation revealed by a mistake made in heat, everything was tied together to his past.

"Who are you? And who am I?"

A series of mysteries ensued. A mysterious bandit in the royal capital, an informer in the lower town, a nobleman's crime that could not be seen--
"--Ah, it's so sad. What will it take for you to believe me?"
"--Until you're willing to die for me."
"--Oh, that's all right, dear. If you are in danger one day, I will die for you.”

◆ Gameplay Instructions


When reading the story, you can determine the actions of the Omega, Hong'er, through various choices that will lead to different outcomes.
It is up to you to decide whether you can unravel Red's past and reach the true ending.

◆Game Features


◇ 12 CGs, 2 sex plots
◇ Game text 55,000
◇ Two main male characters, one male side character and one female side character
◇ Game endings: 9 types, including one True Ending

content_descriptors.notes:
This Game may contain content not appropriate for all ages, or may not be appropriate for viewing at work . The game contains Nudity or Sexual Content, General Mature Content, sexual assault/non-consensual sex, drug/alcohol abuse.
All characters are over the age of 20.

◆ Story


On a rainy night a few years ago, Molly, the owner of a bar, took in Hong'er, who had lost his memory.

Life was happy now; even without the past, he could live a quiet life as Molly's adopted son.

short_description: As an Omega male, although I worked in a bar as a dancer, it was my number one rule not to sell my body. However, for the first time, I met someone who, instead of being angry or starting to show me respect, still clang to me after I'd thrown him over my shoulder. Was this person actually a masochist?
supported_languages: Traditional Chinese, English, Thai, Simplified Chinese
